election_record.label: Vermont 1801 Clerk of the House of Representatives

office.name: Clerk of the House of Representatives

role.title: Clerk of the House of Representatives

overview.note: "Another letter, to the Editors, says- "I hasten to announce, through you, that republicanism is once more triumphant in Vernmont...The former speaker, Amos Marsh, Esq. was almost unanimously re-elected; but upon the election of Clerk, a division took place, and the republican candidate, James Elliot, Esq. was elected by 90 votes to 79.'" American. And Baltimore Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). November 3, 1801. The Independent Chronicle: and the Universal Advertiser (Boston, MA). October 26, 1801.

election_record.reference: The Independent Chronicle: and the Universal Advertiser (Boston, MA). October 26, 1801.
American. And Baltimore Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). November 3, 1801.
